intro: Hieracium vaudense, commonly known as the Vaud hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium vaudense is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
